title: David Bowie coin launched towards space by Royal Mint
description: The coin featuring the Starman singer was sent to an altitude of more than 35,000m.

title: Ikea scraps traditional catalogue after 70 years
description: The end of the catalogue is “emotional but rational” as fewer people are reading it, the company says.

title: Going undercover in the schools that chain boys
description: Reporter Fateh Al-Rahman Al-Hamdani writes about his experience of secretly filming inside Sudan's Islamic boarding schools to expose abuse, and reveals why the investigation was so personal to him.

title: I'm A Celeb stars sang Disney to keep private conversations off TV
description: The runner up has been chatting with Radio 1's Greg James about life in the castle.

title: Manchester Arena bomber's brother Hashem Abedi admits involvement
description: Hashem Abedi, who was jailed for murdering the 22 victims, admits his involvement for the first time.

title: Brexit: UK-EU talks resume in final push for trade deal
description: The UK says there is still time to reach an agreement, but the EU mood is described as "downbeat".

title: Salisbury Novichok-poisoned police officer 'fighting for pension'
description: Det Sgt Nick Bailey, who was contaminated with the nerve agent, left Wiltshire Police in October.

title: Covid: Most of California under strict new lockdown as cases surge
description: Around 85% of the state's 40 million people are under a stay-at-home order that includes Christmas.

title: 'Magical' monolith appears on Isle of Wight beach in the UK
description: A similar structure found in the US last month caused wild speculation online and apparent copycats.

title: Thousands of fireworks light up sky as fire rages
description: It took hundreds of firefighters several hours to bring the flames under control in southern Russia.

title: Covid: Army could be used to transport vaccine, says minister
description: The comments from minister James Cleverly come a day before vaccinations are due to begin.

title: Rita Ora apologises for second breach of Covid lockdown restrictions
description: The pop star should have been isolating at home after a trip to Egypt when she threw a party.

title: Australia shark attack: Surfer survives mauling that was like 'being hit by a truck'
description: A surfer who survived a great white attack in Australia is said to be lucky to be alive.

title: Mike Ashley's Frasers Group in Debenhams rescue talks
description: Mr Ashley's Frasers Group eyes a bid for the chain but says there is "no certainty" it will happen.

title: South Africa v England: Tourists wait for news on positive coronavirus tests
description: England do not expect their two "unconfirmed positive tests" for coronavirus to be independently ratified until Tuesday.

title: Covid-19 vaccine: 'Others deserve it before me'
description: Laura Nuttall, who has terminal brain cancer, says older people should be ahead of her in the queue.

title: Among Us: What makes this online game so popular?
description: The online multiplayer game has seen downloads soar in the last few months, BBC Click finds out more.

title: The Papers: PM 'ready to quit' EU talks, and vaccine 'V Day'
description: The latest news on the Brexit talks and the roll-out of the Covid-19 vaccine lead the front pages.

title: 'Kevin's identity was stolen by police after he died'
description: The Met Police faces legal action after undercover officers used four dead children's identities.

title: Covid-19 vaccination: Needle phobia - it's the jab, not the vaccine, some fear
description: Up to one in 10 of the population are anxious about injections - so what can they do?

title: Coronation Street in numbers, as the famous soap turns 60
description: Stars of the world's longest-running soap look back at 60 years of life on the cobbles.

title: Robertson edges Trump to win epic UK Championship final
description: Neil Robertson edges past world number one Judd Trump 10-9 to win his third UK Championship in what turned out to be an attritional final.

title: Why Europe's big cannabis route is so hard to shut
description: Authorities are struggling to stop smugglers moving drugs over the Greek-Albanian border.

title: Would you trust a 'virtual nanny' with your kids?
description: As parents have struggled with childcare this year, a number of tech firms are offering solutions.

title: Why Arsenal's Aubameyang has lost his scoring belief - Jermaine Jenas analysis
description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's lack of confidence in Sunday's defeat by Tottenham is an ongoing issue for Gunners boss Mikel Arteta.

title: Rose Island: Netflix adapts the story of 'prince of anarchists' Giorgio Rosa
description: A new Netflix film tells the story of Giorgio Rosa and the island he built off the coast of Italy.

title: The disabled activist who led a historic 24-day sit-in
description: Judy Heumann has fought all her life to challenge the stereotypes and misconceptions associated with disability.

title: Letters to kids: Why it's a good time to write to your children
description: If you've been struck by the feeling of living through history, maybe it's time to write it down.

title: Byron Bay: Why a famous Australian beach is disappearing
description: A change in wave patterns - the worst in decades - is "starving" sand from Byron Bay's iconic beach.

title: Our Lives: 'I became a painter during lockdown'
description: Xavier Leopold took up painting during lockdown, discovering a positive way of looking after his mental health.

title: What's it like moving back home (as an adult)?
description: The coronavirus pandemic has led millions of young Americans to move back in with their parents.
